result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan James Kozlowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with co-defendant Efren Gutierrez Jr.

Upon successful completion of probation term, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015. Court states the defendant is not to commit any further criminal offenses, he is not to have any Probation holds, and/or serve any ATR for expungment to occur.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. 
**Drug Buy Money is Joint and Several w/co-defendant-Efren Guitterez Jr. Waushara County Case 16CF5**

timeConds.notes: With Huber. No Good Time Credit. Court does not object to jail transfer but will not say it is okay to serve the sentence with EMD.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Re: Revocation of Work Release

Case Called @ 2:31 PM: Defendant Nathan James Kozlowski in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant understands nature of State's Motion.  Defendant will not contest the allegations of the motion.  Court will accept allegations as proven.  Defendant will not contest revocation of work release privileges.  Court will grant the State's request that work release be revoked.  No GT to address.  Balance of sentence will be served without Work Release privileges.
Motion hearing on January 31, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
to Revoke Work Release Privileges and/or Forfeiture of Good Time Credit

Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 1:27 pm case called. Defendant Nathan James Kozlowski in court with attorney Katherine Seifert.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record. State moves to amend Count 1 to Possession of a Schedule 1 Narcotic in violation of 961.41(3g)(am). Attorney Seifer concurs.   Defendant advised of permissible punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts amendment as stated by DA Blader. Plea: No Contest. Court accept plea and enters JOC. Statement by DA Blader. Attorney Seifert makes a statement. No statement by defendant. Waiver of PSI by both counsel. Court makes statement to defendant prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places defendant on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS: 120 days WCJ, with Huber, No Good Time Credit, No credit for time served. To begin no later than November 11, 2016. Court will not object to jail transfer but will not say it is okay for the sentence to be served with EMD. AODA and follow through.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No Contact with co-defendant Efren Gutierrez Jr. Terms of Agent. Costs to include Attorney Seifert's fees and $119 drug buy money-and is to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Buy money is joint/several with co-defendant.  Court will allow the defendant the opportunity to expunge upon successful completion of supervision inclusive of no criminal offenses along with no ATR's and/or holds.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 13, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Katherine Seifert in court appearing in person.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  P/S requested and scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 13, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Case called @ 1:57 p.m. Defendant Nathan James Kozlowski in court with attorney Katherine Seifert.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed by ADA Anderson. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NG Plea entered. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Def understands that he will be responsible for attorney's fees.  Court will appoint counsel upon the payment of a deposit of $250 no later than 3/4/2016 with a $100 per month to commence on 4/1/2016.  PP to continue until further order of the Court.

Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.    The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:08 PM: Defendant Nathan James Kozlowski in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel.  Employed full time.  Def referred to SPD for eligibility.  Def is to meet with SPD immediately following court today.  ADA argues for $2500 Signature Bond with conditions.  No Statement as to bond.   IA  Scheduled - NOH Given.    Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
